meanings.definition: The quality or state of being throaty.
meanings.sent1: Her singing had a unique throatinesses that set her apart from the other performers.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the throatinesses in his voice as he spoke softly.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow had a cute little throatinesses to it.
meanings.sent4: The throatinesses of the engine made it sound like a roaring beast.
meanings.sent5: The throatinesses of the cello added a rich depth to the music.

meanings.definition: The sound or quality of being husky or hoarse.
meanings.sent1: After cheering at the game, his voice took on a noticeable throatinesses.
meanings.sent2: The singer's throatinesses added a raw emotion to the song.
meanings.sent3: The frog's croak had a comical throatinesses to it.
meanings.sent4: The throatinesses of the old radio made it sound like it was from another era.
meanings.sent5: The throatinesses of the wind through the trees created a haunting melody.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having a deep or rough voice.
meanings.sent1: His throatinesses gave his voice a rugged charm.
meanings.sent2: The actor's throatinesses added a mysterious quality to his character.
meanings.sent3: The robot's voice had an unexpected throatinesses that made it endearing.
meanings.sent4: The throatinesses of the old sailor's voice hinted at years of stories.
meanings.sent5: The throatinesses of the thunder made the storm feel even more powerful.
